enjoy your evening - and stay warm !

documents.title: henley festival wins national award
text: elton john 's performance at this summer 's henley festival has won the headliner of the year prize at this year 's uk festival awards .
the singer performed on 6 june in front of thousands of fans alongside the river thames .

documents.title: thousands campaign for cystic fibrosis drug orkambi to be made available on nhs
text: a father is among thousands of people campaigning to make a new cystic fibrosis drug available on the nhs .
kevin cramner , from inglewood , said access to orkambi would `` massively reduce '' his 12-year-old daughter 's dependence on antibiotics .
the national institute for health and care excellence ( nice ) said the drug was not `` cost effective '' as there was no long-term data available .
it costs more than £ 100,000 a year for each patient .
author: Emma Midgley
BBC News

documents.title: frank turner visits bbc radio berkshire
text: the musician stopped by during his uk tour ahead of tonight 's performance at the hexagon in reading .

documents.title: `` i 've always been me ''
text: four year ago , peter cornhill was a dad-of two , and a hamsphire firefighter .
while still a parent and a hampshire firefighter , peter is now a woman , called katie .
she joined the bbc 's sarah walker to share her story .

documents.title: thames valley police 's # mannequinchallenge
text: are 'compelling ' films like this take on the # mannequinchallenge from thames valley police effective ?

documents.title: woman injured in hit-and-run remains in 'life-threatening ' condition
text: an elderly woman left seriously injured following a hit-and-run in slough last week remains in a life-threatening condition , according to police .
thames valley police has renewed its appeal for witnesses after the victim , who is in her 80s , was involved in a collision with a white mercedes sprinter van on the a4 london road , langley .
investigating officer pc joy jarvis said she was interested in speaking to anyone who may have captured the van on a mobile phone or dashcam before or after the incident .
author: Toby Wadey
BBC Berkshire Online

documents.title: berkshire weather latest : freezing conditions continue
text: temperatures will dip to -2c tonight after another bright and dry day .
a few shallow mist and fog patches may also develop later in the night with widespread frost forecast .

documents.title: fans react to possible reading fc sale on social media
text: here 's what people have been saying on twitter in response to news that reading 's thai owners look set to sell their controlling share in the club .
potential new # readingfc owner reportedly failed fit & proper person test when trying to take over hull .
oh that 's reassuring then
no .
one of the consortium did .
this time it 's just the brother and sister .
well @ twitterid need to correct their story then !
no they did n't , was other part of consortium that failed
if they were found of wrongdoing and the club frozen as an asset , would they have to sell to supporters ?
seeing that this takeover could happen within the next couple of weeks ?
perfect for january activity .
# readingfc
that depends .
remember how long it actually took the thais to loosen the purse strings ?
true , hopefuly this time round will be different .
tbh i 'm more worried about if they 'll get rid of stam and co
true , that would be insanity .
i 'd probably say forget the money , keeping stam in charge is the most important thing right now !
stability is key .
quelle surprise that the thais want to keep the land but sell the club and ground .
always seemed a likely scenario .
# readingfc

documents.title: new rail links to heathrow 'essential ' if third runway built
text: concerns over air pollution around heathrow mean new rail links to the airport will be essential if a third runway is to get the go ahead , the government has confirmed .
transport secretary chris grayling said the government had some concerns over costs , after budgets rose for the crossrail project to link the airport to central london .
but he said new rail lines between heathrow , reading and london 's waterloo station would be `` essential '' for meeting legal targets on clean air .

documents.title: a guide to understanding the types of ambulance call
text: control room operators are responsible for putting emergency calls into categories which make it easier to determine how urgent an ambulance is needed at the scene .
each category has a response time - with the quickest response being eight minutes for life threatening emergencies .

red 1 and red 2 are the most urgent categories , with the first being for respiratory/cardiac arrest where two resources are dispatched to the incident and the second for all other life threatening situations .
then there are green 1 , 2 , 3 and 4 .
green 1 and 2 are for serious but not life threatening calls with a response time of 20-30 minutes and blue lights and sirens .
green 3 and 4 are neither serious nor life threatening .
an operator will give an assessment over the phone for green 3 within 20 minutes and the response time for both categories is 60 minutes with no blue lights .

documents.title: reading fc sale 'would not include land around the stadium '
text: reading fc 's current thai owners intend to retain ownership of land around the madejski stadium in any deal to sell the club .
the consortium , which took took control of the championship club in september 2014 , want to keep the site earmarked for redevelopment , as well as the millennium madejski hotel .

fans have always had their sus that lady sasima srivikorn , sumrith thanakarnjanasuth and narin niruttinanon were only ever interested in the value of the real estate , rather than the football club .
if this deal happens it would just confirm those sus
the club is making no comment at the moment .
author: Tim Dellor
BBC Berkshire sport editor

documents.title: simonds & son : reading 's beer revolution
text: radio berkshire 's andrew peach broadcast live from the loddon brewery this morning as we told the story of one of the royal county 's most iconic beer makers .
the show featured a special drama , commissioned as part of reading 's year of culture .

documents.title: lilly-may page death 'could have been prevented '
text: a five-year-old girl who collapsed outside her school in 2014 could have been saved if she had been shocked with a defibrillator , an inquest has heard .
lilly-may page died after collapsing from an undiagnosed heart condition near willow bank school in woodley , berkshire , in 2014 .
a paramedic decided not to use a defibrillator on the girl .
cardiologist dr edmund ladusans said she would have survived if she had been shocked .
author: Sarah Lee
South Online

documents.title: who are the brother and sister vying to buy reading fc ?
text: the prospective new owners of reading fc failed in an attempt to purchase premier league side hull city in september .
that deal fell through amid speculation that brother and sister dai yongge and dai xui li had not passed the fa 's fit and proper person test .
my source tells me yongge is extremely ambitious to turn reading into a premier league club , and is already being encouraged to invest in the squad during the january transfer window .
yongge is a chinese businessman who speaks no english .
he favours reading as an investment because he already flies in and out of london regularly for business meetings , and i 'm told he likes the demographics reading offer .
the club have so far declined to comment .
read more here .
author: Tim Dellor
BBC Berkshire sport editor

documents.title: slough woman commended for bravery for stepping in and breaking up altercation
text: a woman who stepped in to stop an altercation between two men and prevented further injury has been commended for her bravery by the chief constable of thames valley police .
annie gough , 22 , was praised by chief constable francis habgood at an awards ceremony at sulhamstead force training centre , reading last week .
miss gough was working behind the bar of ye olde george public house , high street , slough , when a fight broke out between two men on 3 april 2014 .
she asked both of the men , who were customers , to leave .
the altercation continued outside the pub and miss gough ran outside to intervene .
she called 999 to report the incident and has supported investigations and the prosecution of both men .

documents.title: breakingthai consortium on brink of selling reading fc
text: the thai consortium that owns reading football club is on the brink of selling its shares to a chinese brother and sister .
dai yongge and dai xui li may not be names known by reading fans yet , but if negotiations go smoothly they could own the vast majority of the club 's shares within a fortnight .
my sources tell me the deal is not yet done , but clearly change is afoot .
the thais would remain owners of the land earmarked for redevelopment and the millennium madejski hotel , but are looking to sell the stadium , the club and the training ground .
author: Tim Dellor
BBC Berkshire sport editor

documents.title: south central ambulance dispatcher 'you 've got nothing to go '
text: one dispatcher working from the control room in hampshire said it can be very tricky for them to manage the ambulances .
she said : `` as a dispatcher you can sit and you know that you 've got sometimes 10 , 20 , 30 patients who are waiting for an ambulance resource and you 've got nothing available to go . ''
author: David Fenton
Health Correspondent, BBC South

documents.title: after dark is 'reading 's cavern club ' , says fan
text: fans of reading 's after dark club have rallied to the club 's defence in objecting to a plan to build flats in the area .
one supporter wrote in `` the after dark has for long time been part of reading 's history and many famous acts have played here .
this is reading 's 'cavern club ' .
it would be a terrible loss in reading 's year of culture . ''
another person pointed out the club holds a regular charitable night , and another called for the building to be listed as a local heritage asset .
however , reading planning officers said there was `` no planning policy conflict with the principle of removing the night club use from this area . ''
a club has been based on the site for 40 years , and the after dark generates a `` very low '' number of complaints , council officers said .

documents.title: scas missing response time target
text: figures for march this year showed south central ambulance service was responding to 69.1 % of category 1 calls within the eight-minute target .
the government has said 75 % of all life-threatening calls must be answered within the eight minutes .
but as you can see from march , only one trust - west midlands - managed to get over the 75 % mark .
the average response time for the whole of england was 66.5 % .

documents.title: out and about with the ambulance service this morning
text: in berkshire , which is served by south central ambulance service , our reporter has been out with crews from wexham ambulance station this morning .
spending the morning with teams from wexham ambulance station this is what its like for paramedics getting through traffic @ twitterid

documents.title: after dark club planning application recommended for refusal
text: reading clubbers are relieved to hear a planning application to build flats on the site of one of the town 's nightclubs has been recommended for refusal .
red kite development consultancy proposed to demolish the after dark club and replace it with 10 flats .
the venue says it `` attracts a happy mix of students and native reading folk '' and describes itself as one of reading 's `` best and busiest independent nightclubs . ''
council officers said :
author: Emma Midgley
BBC News

documents.title: tens of thousands watch police mannequin challenge
text: an internet video about domestic violence , made by thames valley police , has been viewed more than forty thousand times .
the force used the mannequin challenge to communicate a serious message - the viral trend sees people remain frozen in action like mannequins while a video is recorded .
one of the digital team thought it was a huge opportunity to actually use [ the mannequin challenge ] to underpin messages around domestic abuse .
author: Tara Maxwell
BBC Radio Berkshire newsreader

it 's going to feel cold though .
we can expect -5c or -6c again tonight , with a little more cloud tomorrow .

documents.title: increase in ambulance call-outs in berkshire
text: a bbc investigation has found rising demand has left the ambulance system at breaking point .
in wokingham , there 's been an 80 % increase in the most serious calls compared to 3 years ago .
it comes as south central ambulance struggles with response times - it 's only managed to reach government targets in one month since june last year .
patients with life-threatening conditions - like cardiac arrests - are meant to be reached in eight minutes .
but only one of the uk 's 13 ambulance services is currently meeting its target .
ambulance bosses are blaming rising demand and pressure in the system .

documents.title: coldest day of the year so far
text: good morning !
it 's icy and frosty out there this morning , but a bright sunny day awaits us .
we 'll be bringing you the latest news , weather , travel and sport from berkshire on our local live service .
keep in touch with us on our facebook and twitter pages .
author: Emma Midgley
BBC News
